articles.headline: To Contain Iran, Trump’s Newest Line in the Sand Looks a Lot Like Obama’s
articles.snippet: Embracing a one-year “breakout” period — a time limit on Iran’s ability to make fuel for a nuclear bomb — was at the heart of the 2015 accord that the U.S. left in May 2018.
articles.abstract: Embracing a one-year “breakout” period — a time limit on Iran’s ability to make fuel for a nuclear bomb — was at the heart of the 2015 accord that the U.S. left in May 2018.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Pressed this week to define President Trump’s goals in escalating military and economic pressure on Iran, one of his top foreign policy aides ticked through a familiar list: End the country’s support for terrorism, stop its missile launches and then, most important, keep Iran more than a year away from the capability to build a nuclear weapon.

articles.headline: Boeing 737 Max Simulators Are in High Demand. They Are Flawed.
articles.snippet: The flight simulators are unable to accurately replicate the difficult conditions created by a malfunctioning system on the jet, which played a role in two fatal crashes.
articles.abstract: The flight simulators are unable to accurately replicate the difficult conditions created by a malfunctioning system on the jet, which played a role in two fatal crashes.
articles.lead_paragraph: Since the two fatal crashes of the Boeing 737 Max, airlines around the world have moved to buy flight simulators to train their pilots.

articles.headline: Pub Work Gives a Royal Carpet Maker an Unwelcome Image (and It’s Sticking)
articles.snippet: Axminster has Buckingham Palace’s seal of approval. But thanks to social media, its best-known client is a chain of cut-price bars.
articles.abstract: Axminster has Buckingham Palace’s seal of approval. But thanks to social media, its best-known client is a chain of cut-price bars.
articles.lead_paragraph: AXMINSTER, England — The royal coat of arms is affixed to a sign on the front of the Axminster Carpets factory, near the train station in this town of 6,000 in southwest England. Beneath the seal are the words “By Appointment to Her Majesty the Queen/Carpet Manufacturer.”

articles.headline: Austrian Leader Calls for Snap Election After Far-Right Vice Chancellor Resigns
articles.snippet: A 2017 video that was secretly filmed showed Vice Chancellor Heinz-Christian Strache promising government contracts to a woman claiming to be the niece of a Russian oligarch.
articles.abstract: A 2017 video that was secretly filmed showed Vice Chancellor Heinz-Christian Strache promising government contracts to a woman claiming to be the niece of a Russian oligarch.
articles.lead_paragraph: BERLIN — Austria’s leadership was thrown into turmoil on Saturday after a video emerged that raised questions about whether Russia had direct influence inside a government at the heart of Europe.
articles.byline: By Katrin Bennhold and Christopher F. Schuetze

articles.headline: Colombia Army’s New Kill Orders Send Chills Down Ranks
articles.snippet: Senior officers told The Times that soldiers are under intense pressure to defeat rebel groups and that a pattern of suspicious killings and cover-ups has begun to emerge this year.
articles.abstract: Senior officers told The Times that soldiers are under intense pressure to defeat rebel groups and that a pattern of suspicious killings and cover-ups has begun to emerge this year.
articles.lead_paragraph: BOGOTÁ, Colombia — The head of Colombia’s army, frustrated by the nation’s faltering efforts to secure peace, has ordered his troops to double the number of criminals and militants they kill, capture or force to surrender in battle — and possibly accept higher civilian casualties in the process, according to written orders and interviews with senior officers.

articles.headline: Running Scared: Network TV in the Streaming Age
articles.snippet: Viewers are fleeing for Netflix. The ones who stay are older than the group prized by advertisers. Here’s a look back at the troubled 2018-19 season.
articles.abstract: Viewers are fleeing for Netflix. The ones who stay are older than the group prized by advertisers. Here’s a look back at the troubled 2018-19 season.
articles.lead_paragraph: As the curtain comes down on the 2018-19 television season, the major broadcast networks found themselves sinking deeper into trouble.

articles.headline: Abortion Fight or Strong Economy? For G.O.P., Cultural Issues Undercut 2020 Message
articles.snippet: The longstanding verity that Americans vote with their pocketbook may be tested in the presidential election like never before, as Trump injects cultural and identity issues into the race.
articles.abstract: The longstanding verity that Americans vote with their pocketbook may be tested in the presidential election like never before, as Trump injects cultural and identity issues into the race.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The unemployment rate is at a 50-year low, companies are adding jobs and the gross domestic product grew by 3.2 percent in the first quarter, undercutting predictions of a coming recession.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Martin and Alexander Burns

articles.headline: Fighting Ebola When Mourners Fight the Responders
articles.snippet: An Ebola outbreak in eastern Congo — the second-largest in history — is escalating in part because locals don’t trust health workers and government officials.
articles.abstract: An Ebola outbreak in eastern Congo — the second-largest in history — is escalating in part because locals don’t trust health workers and government officials.
articles.lead_paragraph: BENI, Democratic Republic of Congo — When Ebola came to this city in the Democratic Republic of Congo, Janvier Muhindo Mandefu quit farming and got work burying the highly contagious bodies of Ebola victims.
articles.byline: By Joseph Goldstein and Finbarr O'Reilly

articles.headline: Deutsche Bank Staff Saw Suspicious Activity in Trump and Kushner Accounts
articles.snippet: Anti-money-laundering specialists proposed filing “suspicious activity reports” about transactions connected to President Trump and Jared Kushner. Bank managers said no.
articles.abstract: Anti-money-laundering specialists proposed filing “suspicious activity reports” about transactions connected to President Trump and Jared Kushner. Bank managers said no.
articles.lead_paragraph: JACKSONVILLE, Fla. — Anti-money-laundering specialists at Deutsche Bank recommended in 2016 and 2017 that multiple transactions involving legal entities controlled by Donald J. Trump and his son-in-law, Jared Kushner, be reported to a federal financial-crimes watchdog.

articles.headline: Morehouse College Graduates’ Student Loans to Be Paid Off by Billionaire
articles.snippet: Robert F. Smith, who founded Vista Equity Partners and became the richest black man in America, said that he and his family would pay the Class of 2019’s debt.
articles.abstract: Robert F. Smith, who founded Vista Equity Partners and became the richest black man in America, said that he and his family would pay the Class of 2019’s debt.
articles.lead_paragraph: The 396 young men began the day as students in caps and gowns, ready to graduate from Morehouse College — full of hope, but burdened in most cases with the debts that financed their education.
articles.byline: By Audra D. S. Burch, David Gelles and Emily S. Rueb

articles.headline: Tech Jobs Lead to the Middle Class. Just Not for the Masses.
articles.snippet: The great hope for people without a bachelor’s degree hasn’t yet spread beyond small-scale success stories.
articles.abstract: The great hope for people without a bachelor’s degree hasn’t yet spread beyond small-scale success stories.
articles.lead_paragraph: Brittney Ball was living in a homeless shelter with her baby when she learned of a one-year program offering technical training, professional skills and an internship. She took the plunge.

articles.headline: As ‘Rocketman’ Prepares to Take Off, Hollywood Holds Its Breath
articles.snippet: Depending on ticket sales, the R-rated musical fantasia about Elton John could have ripple effects for its star, its studio and the wider film industry.
articles.abstract: Depending on ticket sales, the R-rated musical fantasia about Elton John could have ripple effects for its star, its studio and the wider film industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Multiple movie studios passed on the opportunity to make “Rocketman,” an R-rated musical fantasia about Elton John’s hedonistic breakthrough years. Too gay. Too expensive. Too reliant on an unproven star.

articles.headline: Kissing Babies, Loving Scrapple, Fighting Viral Hoaxes: ’20 Race’s New Routine
articles.snippet: When it comes to disinformation, all signs suggest the 2020 presidential campaign will make 2016 look like a mere test run, our columnist writes.
articles.abstract: When it comes to disinformation, all signs suggest the 2020 presidential campaign will make 2016 look like a mere test run, our columnist writes.
articles.lead_paragraph: It’s unlikely you have heard of @ToTheXToTheY. But you may be familiar with its work.

articles.headline: Amazon Faces Investor Pressure Over Facial Recognition
articles.snippet: Shareholders are voting on whether to push the tech giant to examine the human rights and financial risks of the surveillance technology.
articles.abstract: Shareholders are voting on whether to push the tech giant to examine the human rights and financial risks of the surveillance technology.
articles.lead_paragraph: Facial recognition software is coming under increasing scrutiny from civil liberties groups and lawmakers. Now Amazon, one of the most visible purveyors of the technology, is facing pressure from another corner as well: its own shareholders.

articles.headline: Whitney Houston’s Estate Plans a Hologram Tour and a New Album
articles.snippet: The family of the singing star, who died seven years ago, has reached a deal with the marketing company behind the posthumous resurgence of Bob Marley.
articles.abstract: The family of the singing star, who died seven years ago, has reached a deal with the marketing company behind the posthumous resurgence of Bob Marley.
articles.lead_paragraph: Since Whitney Houston died in 2012, her estate has been pitched every kind of entertainment deal, from jukebox musicals to a traveling museum.

articles.headline: The Choice in India: ‘Our Trump’ or a Messier Democracy
articles.snippet: The results of India’s parliamentary election will reveal not just a decision on Narendra Modi, but a deeper decision on what kind of government Indians want.
articles.abstract: The results of India’s parliamentary election will reveal not just a decision on Narendra Modi, but a deeper decision on what kind of government Indians want.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI — In Hungary, Viktor Orban demonized immigrants and secured an expansion of his power. In Turkey, Recep Tayyip Erdogan purged his enemies and won a new term. In Australia, Scott Morrison shrugged off calls for tougher carbon-emissions rules and was unexpectedly kept on as leader.

articles.headline: U.S. Tech Suppliers, Including Google, Restrict Dealings With Huawei After Trump Order
articles.snippet: The moves could hamstring the Chinese tech giant, escalating a cold war between China and the United States over technology and trade.
articles.abstract: The moves could hamstring the Chinese tech giant, escalating a cold war between China and the United States over technology and trade.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — The Chinese technology giant Huawei on Monday began to feel the painful ripple effects of a Trump administration order that effectively bars American firms from selling components and software to the company, ramping up a cold war between the two countries over technology and trade.
articles.byline: By Adam Satariano, Raymond Zhong and Daisuke Wakabayashi

articles.headline: T-Mobile-Sprint Merger Wins Approval of F.C.C. Chairman
articles.snippet: Ajit Pai said the companies had secured his support by making what he called “significant commitments” to expand rural broadband service, build a robust 5G network and sell off Boost Mobile.
articles.abstract: Ajit Pai said the companies had secured his support by making what he called “significant commitments” to expand rural broadband service, build a robust 5G network and sell off Boost Mobile.
articles.lead_paragraph: T-Mobile and Sprint moved a step closer on Monday to completing their long-sought merger, securing the public support of the Federal Communications Commission’s chairman for a deal that would reshape the country’s wireless industry.

articles.headline: As Huawei Loses Google, the U.S.-China Tech Cold War Gets Its Iron Curtain
articles.snippet: The White House’s hard-line approach threatens to speed up the development of two technology worlds, further isolating one-fifth of internet users.
articles.abstract: The White House’s hard-line approach threatens to speed up the development of two technology worlds, further isolating one-fifth of internet users.
articles.lead_paragraph: China has spent nearly two decades building a digital wall between itself and the rest of the world, a one-way barrier designed to keep out foreign companies like Facebook and Google while allowing Chinese rivals to leave home and expand across the world.
